newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Taiwan tenders to buy September fuel oil.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan tenders to buy September fuel oil.

text.p: Taiwan's state-owned Chinese Petroleum Corp (CPC) has issued a tender to buy 0.5-percent sulphur fuel oil for September delivery, a company source said on Thursday.
The tender, which seeks a 38,000-tonne low-pour cargo for September 1-15 and a high-pour cargo for September 11-30, closes on July 22 and is valid for two days.
In its last purchase tender, Taiwan bought two 38,000-tonne fuel oil cargoes at $132 and $123 per tonne for August delivery.

The first 0.5-percent cargo was bought at around $132 per tonne and the second 1.0-percent cargo, with an American Petroleum Institute (API) gravity of 15 degrees and a viscosity of 140-centistoke, was at about $123 per tonne.
